page.title: 07NATURE OF POLWARTH SOIL
page.content: AT KYLE'S HILL THE ROCK IS SANDSTONE. THE NAME KYLE'S HILL IS NOT IN THE 18 CENTURY ACCOUNTS IN REGISTER HOUSE EDINBURGH APPERTAINING TO THE BUILDING OF MARCHMONT, BUT AN IMMENSE AMOUNT OF STONE FOR A VERY LARGE BUILDING HAS BEEN QUARRIED & IT IS LIKELY THAT IT WAS IN PART MARCHMONT.EVEN ALTHOUGH THE PLANE BELONGING TO BATTLE OF BRITAIN PILOT, RICHARD HILLARY CRASHED THERE. THE HOLE IS PARTLY FILLED BY THE COUNCIL WITH NON TOXIC SLUDGE. THE REST OF THE LAND IS MEDIUM LOAM OF A VERY RED, BECAUSE FERRIGINEOUS, NATURE,EXCEPT, AS AT THE GARDENS AT MARCHMONT, WHERE IT HAS BEEN HEAVILY MULCHED OVER THE CENTURIES & IS ALMOST BLACK. FORESTRY IS ANOTHER FORM OF HUSBANDRY WELL SUITED TO THIS TERRAIN & THERE IS A PROGRAMME OF THINNING & REPLANTING BOTH SOFT & HARD WOODS.
